SENT.plain: A 47-year-old male presented with frequent transient ischemic attacks (TIAs) of weakness of the left upper extremity
Computed tomography demonstrated multiple infarcts in the right cerebral hemisphere
Cerebral angiography showed marked atheromatous changes at the siphon of the right internal carotid artery, characterized by wall irregularities and heterogeneous filling
Indium-111-labeled platelet scintigraphy demonstrated abnormal tracer accumulation at the right carotid siphon
Following right carotid artery ligation, this abnormal platelet deposition was resolved and no further TIA was experienced
This suggests that the release of microthrombi from thrombogenic carotid atheroma contributes to embolic stroke
